title: Mad Hot Ballroom
descriptions:
Mad Hot Ballroom is a 2005 American documentary film directed by Marilyn Agrelo. The film follows a group of 11-year-old students from three New York City public elementary schools as they participate in a citywide ballroom dance competition.

The students, from diverse backgrounds, are taught various ballroom dances by dedicated instructors. The documentary showcases their hard work, dedication, and passion as they prepare for the competition. Along the way, the students learn not only the technical aspects of dance but also valuable life skills such as teamwork, discipline, and self-confidence.

As the competition approaches, the students face their own personal struggles, including family problems, social pressures, and self-doubt. However, through their love of dance and the support of their teachers and peers, they persevere and grow.

The film culminates in the citywide ballroom dance competition, where the students showcase their skills and compete against other schools. Mad Hot Ballroom is an inspiring and heartwarming documentary that celebrates the joy of dance, the power of education, and the resilience of young people.
